title: Regional Operations Repair and Maintenance Manager
content:
At GFiber, we believe in the power of great internet that lets people do more, helps communities get stronger and makes amazing things possible. We’re not just growing to build better internet experiences, we’re also building a welcoming place where people who want to make a difference can grow their careers.
GFiber is an Alphabet company that brings Google Fiber and Google Fiber Webpass internet services to homes and businesses across the United States. Our growing, inclusive team is expanding as we connect more cities and people. *This position can reside in Charlotte, Durham, Raleigh, NC, or Atlanta, GA. 
Role Description
As a Regional Manager for the Metro area, you will ensure that network operations are reliable and efficient by monitoring network performance, performing planned maintenance, proactively identifying and repairing network difficulties, and responding to network connectivity challenges. GFiber  complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which will require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. You and your team will keep the network reliable and ensure that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products, and services. You will perform critical tasks that maintain and improve network operations, and you will take the technical lead in ensuring a reliable and efficient operating network.
In this role, you'll:

Manage the planning and execution of complex and sometimes competing tasks that support our ongoing network operations which includes operational activities from budget planning, schedule maintenance, stakeholder management, metric reporting, and national level initiatives.
Develop and grow a talented Operations team.
Maintain GFiber infrastructure in the market(s) on an ongoing basis, support new acceptance of active network equipment/electronics, and execute new customer installations to support GFiber growth.
Implement a repair and maintenance program to fulfill internal service requirements, being available during non-standard business hours as needed; perform new plant testing and acceptance to ensure products meet quality standards and provide the best experience possible.
Establish and manage positive vendor relationships through effective facilitations and communication.

At a minimum we'd like you to have:

Bachelor's degree in Economics, Management, Engineering, Telecommunications, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience with fiber network management and/or deployments.
10 years of people and vendor management experience.
Experience with budgeting, forecasting costs, project reporting, network capacity planning, quality assurance, network equipment turn-up, testing and acceptance.

It's preferred if you have:

15 years of experience with fiber network management and/or deployments.
15 years of people and vendor management experience.
Experience managing a customer connection program, including the full customer connect lifecycle.
Experience with contract and vendor management.
Experience supporting network escalations and providing detailed technical leadership for troubleshooting and fault resolution.
Experience with network drawings (GIS), interpreting fiber test results, installing and basic configuration of enterprise or carrier grade networking equipment (routers, switches, firewalls, encoders, optics and DWDM).
Experience in operational improvement, process/workflow development, and managing complex cross-functional projects.

 
The US base salary range for this full-time position is between $136,000 - $169,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Your recruiter will share more about the specific salary range for your targeted location during the hiring process.GFiber is committed to equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or Veteran status. Disclosure is voluntary, and this information will be kept confidential in compliance with Google's Candidate Privacy Policy. For more information please refer to our Equal Employment Opportunity Policy and the EEOC's "Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal" (PDF). 
It's important to us to create an accessible, inclusive workplace for everyone. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our accommodations for applicants form. Our candidate accommodations team will then connect with you to confidentially discuss your options.
